data.title: Category: >>Everyman's Library Editions
data.text:
The Spectator (Volume 1 only, of 4) (Everyman's Library, #164)

By: ADDISON, Joseph; STEELE, Richard et al.

Price: $30.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1945

Seller ID: 84653

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good- with no dust jacket

A 1945 revision of the 1906 issuance. Volume 1 only (of 4) of essays, some quite risqu, taken from the English daily literary journal in the years 1711-1715. Though several authors contributed, the majority of these writings were by Joseph Addison and Sir Richard Steele. Includes a preface by G. Gregory Smith. Entry 164 in Everyman's Library Essays and Belles-Lettres series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In Everyman's Library binding style 3 with full orange cloth and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to cover and brown topstain. Volume lacks the dust jacket...

View More...

The Lyrical Dramas of Aeschylus (Everyman's Library "flatback" binding style 1, EL #62)

By: AESCHYLUS; BLACKIE, John Stuart (translator)

Price: $12.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : [c.1906-27]

Seller ID: 81560

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good with no dust jacket

Aeschylus: Plays (Everyman's Library #62)

By: AESCHYLUS; COOKSON, G. M. (translation)

Price: $22.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1956

Seller ID: 88460

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good+ in Very Good+ dust jacket

The Acharnians, and three other Plays of Aristophanes: The Plays of Aristophanes, Volume I (Everyman's Library "flatback" binding style 1)

By: ARISTOPHANES

Price: $12.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1911

Seller ID: 83645

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Fair with no dust jacket

Four comedies by the ancient Greek dramatist Aristophanes (c.450-c.385 B.C.) are presented in this Everyman's Library edition. Includes his "The Acharnians", "The Knights", "The Birds" and "The Peace". Rendered into English by J. Hookham Frere. Introduction by John P. Maine. Number 344 in Everyman's Library Classical series, the first of two collections of plays by Aristophanes in the Everyman's Library series. --- In flatback binding style 1, full pale green cloth-covered boards with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt spine titling & decorations, blindstamped J. M. Dent vignette to fron...

View More...

Pride and Prejudice (Everyman's Library #22)

By: AUSTEN, Jane

Price: $63.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1947

Seller ID: 84655

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

A 1947 reprint of the 1906 issuance. Jane Austen's classic novel offers an array of exquisitely-described characters as she describes the doings of the Bennet family and their acquaintences. With an introduction by R. Brimley Johnson. Number 22 in Everyman's Library catalog in their Fiction series. --- In Everyman's Library binding style 3 with full carmine cloth and spine titling in a gold-toned typeface; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to cover. Volume lacks the dust jacket. --- A sound, tightly-bound copy, but with previous owner's signature to front free endpaper, lightly sunn...

View More...

Literary Studies by Walter Bagehot (in two Everyman's Library volumes, EL #520 & 521)

By: BAGEHOT, Walter

Price: $29.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1916

Seller ID: 87905

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good+ with no dust jacket

1916 reprints of the 1911 issuances. A 2-volume Everyman's Library set presenting writings on literary topics by England's Walter Bagehot (1826-77). A journalist, economist and businessman, Bagehot examined the life and work of notable British authors such as Shakespeare, Dickens, Shelley, Browning and many others, with a few additional essays on politics and economics. With an introduction by George Sampson. Each volume with with its own index. Numbers 520 & 521 in Everyman's Library "Essays and Belles Lettres" series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In 'flatback' binding style 1, full orange clot...

View More...

Old Goriot (Le Pre Goriot) (Everyman's Library #170)

By: BALZAC, Honor de

Price: $15.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1963

Seller ID: 85347

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good with no dust jacket

A 1963 reprint of the 1948 issuance. Set in the author's 19th Century Paris, "Old Goriot" is often referred to by its French title, "Le Pre Goriot", and is perhaps Honor de Balzac's most admired novel. Translated from the French by Ellen Marriage, and with an introduction by Professor Marcel Girard. Number 170 in Everyman's Library Fiction series. --- An ex-library copy in Everyman's Library larger format binding style 4. Full blue cloth-covered boards with gilt-stamped spine titling and gilt interlocked "EL" in script at tail of spine; pale orange topstain. Volume lacks the dust jacket. --- W...

View More...

Lorna Doone: A Romance of Exmoor (In Maroon Leatherette covers, Everyman's Library #304)

By: BLACKMORE, R. D.

Price: $18.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : [c.1908]

Seller ID: 86597

Binding: Flexible Leatherette

Condition: Very Good+ with no dust jacket

An undated, likely first Everyman's Library edition, 1908, of R. D. Blackmore's famous historical romance, which is set in the 17th century and was first published in 1869. The author had trouble getting the novel published, but once available it became tremendously popular and has stayed in print ever since. Edited and with an introduction by Ernest Rhys. Entry 304 in Everyman's Library Fiction series. --- In Everyman's style 1 maroon flexible leatherette variant binding with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt titling & floral decorations to cover and spine, ornate Knowles woodcut illus...

View More...

The Decameron (Complete Two Volume Set) (Everyman's Library #845 & 846)

By: BOCCACCIO, Giovanni

Price: $30.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1946

Seller ID: 86585

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good in Fair dust jacket

A 1946 reprint of the 1930 issuances. A complete, 2-volume Everyman's Library set of Giovanni Boccaccio's famous collection of 100 short stories, which first appeared in Venice in 1471. Translated from the Italian by J. M. Riggs, and with an introduction by Edward Hutton. Numbers 845 & 846 in Everyman's Library Romance series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In EL binding style 3 with full light blue cloth and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to covers, and brown topstain. Volumes wrapped in orange dust jackets with Ravilious 'knot' to front panels. --- With ...

View More...

Lavengro: The Scholar, the Gipsy, the Priest (Everyman's Library #119)

By: BORROW, George

Price: $22.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1907

Seller ID: 85740

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good+ with no dust jacket

A 1907 reprint of the 1906 issuance. Per Donald Armstrong Ross, "Lavengro" is part autobiography and part novel. The author, George Borrow (1803-1881) was an English author who traveled extensively in Europe and was intrigued with the Romany people he found there. Includes an introduction by Thomas Seccombe. Entry 119 in Everyman's Library Fiction series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In flatback binding style 1, full carmine cloth-covered boards with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt spine titling & decorations, blindstamped J. M. Dent vignette to front cover, dark topstain and fancy Know...

View More...

The Romany Rye (Everyman's Library #120)

By: BORROW, George

Price: $17.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1939

Seller ID: 84652

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

A 1939 reprint of the 1906 issuance. A sequel to George Borrow's "Lavengro," continuing the story with the same cast of characters. The author, George Borrow (1803-1881), was an English author who traveled extensively in Europe and was intrigued with the Romany people he found there. Includes a brief preface by the editor. Entry 120 in Everyman's Library fiction series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In Everyman's Library binding style 3 with full carmine cloth and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to cover and brown topstain. Volume lacks the dust jacket. --...

View More...

The Romany Rye (Everyman's Library #120)

By: BORROW, George

Price: $19.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1907

Seller ID: 87007

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

A 1907 reprint of the 1906 issuance. A sequel to George Borrow's "Lavengro," continuing the story with the same cast of characters. The author, George Borrow (1803-1881), was an English author who traveled extensively in Europe and was intrigued with the Romany people he found there. Includes a brief editor's note. Entry 120 in Everyman's Library fiction series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In flatback binding style 1, full ribbed carmine cloth-covered boards with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt spine titling & decorations, blindstamped J. M. Dent vignette to front cover, brown topstain...

View More...

The Sceptical Chymist (Everyman's Library #559)

By: BOYLE, Robert

Price: $30.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1964

Seller ID: 88641

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Near Fine in Very Good+ dust jacket

A 1964 reprint of the 1911 issuance. An Everyman's Library edition presenting Robert Boyle's 1661 work in the field of chemistry. Known as the "father of physical chemistry," the 17th century author's work dispelled many myths and misconceptions about chemistry. Includes an introduction by E. A. Moelwyn-Hughes, and the author's introductory preface. An entry in Everyman's Library Science series. E.L. no. 559. --- In Everyman's Library larger format binding style 4. Full green cloth-covered boards with copper foil spine titling and interlocked 'EL' at tail of spine; orange topstain. In green du...

View More...

Shirley (Everyman's Library #288)

By: BRONT, Charlotte

Price: $17.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1950

Seller ID: 85995

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good- with no dust jacket

A 1950 reprint of the 1908 issuance. An Everyman's Library edition of the second published novel by Charlotte Bront, which followed her "Jane Eyre". The story is set in Yorkshire amidst labor unrest in the textile industry following the Napoleonic Wars. With an introduction by May Sinclair. Entry 288 in Everyman's Library fiction series. --- In EL binding style 3 with full carmine red cloth and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to cover and tan topstain. Volume lacks the dust jacket. --- With a little sunning to spine, else a clean, tightly-bound, sound c...

View More...

The Professor (Everyman's Library #417)

By: BRONT, Charlotte

Price: $19.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1954

Seller ID: 84869

ISBN-13: 9780460004176

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

A 1954 reprint of the 1910 issuance. An Everyman's Library edition presenting the first novel written by Charlotte Bront. Though she wrote it before her notable "Jane Eyre" and other works, it was first published after her death. The story is semi-autobiographical, and draws on her experience as a teacher in Brussels as a young woman. With an introduction by Margaret Lane. Everyman's Library number 417 in their "Fiction" series. --- In Everyman's Library larger format binding style 4. Full rust cloth-covered boards with spine titling and "EL" in script at tail of spine in gilt; orange topstain...

View More...

Shirley (Everyman's Library #288)

By: BRONTË, Charlotte

Price: $13.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1965

Seller ID: 87272

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Fair with no dust jacket

A 1965 reprint edition of the 1908 issuance. An ex-library copy of the second published novel by Charlotte Brontë. "Shirley," which followed her "Jane Eyre," first appeared in 1849 under her Currer Bell pseudonym. The story is set in Yorkshire amidst labor unrest in the textile industry following the Napoleonic Wars. With an introduction by Margaret Lane. Entry 288 in Everyman's Library fiction series. --- In EL larger format binding style 4. Full green cloth-covered boards with gilt-stamped spine titling and gilt interlocked "EL" in script at tail of spine. Volume lacks the dust jacket. --- A...

View More...

The Professor -and- Emma: A Fragment (Everyman's Library #417)

By: BRONTË, Charlotte

Price: $11.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1969

Seller ID: 84835

ISBN-13: 9780460004176

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Fair with no dust jacket

A 1969 reprint edition of the 1910 issuance. An ex-library copy of an Everyman's Library reprint edition presenting the first novel written by Charlotte Brontë. Though she wrote it before her notable "Jane Eyre" and other works, it was first published after her death. The story is semi-autobiographical, and draws on her experience as a teacher in Brussels as a young woman. Also with two chapters from author's "Emma", her unfinished novel, which is preceded by an introduction by William Makepeace Thackeay entitled "The Last Sketch." With an introduction by Margaret Lane. --- In EL larger format...

View More...

Religio Medici (Everyman's Library #92)

By: BROWNE, Sir Thomas

Price: $20.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1965

Seller ID: 88629

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good in Good+ dust jacket

A 1965 reprint of the 1906 issuance. An Everyman's Library edition of the famous treatise on religion and Christianity by Sir Thomas Browne (1605-1682). The author was an intellectual who wrote on a wide variety of subjects. Includes an introduction by Halliday Sutherland. Entry 92 in the Everyman's Library theology & philosophy series. --- Full plum cloth-covered boards with orange topstain. In blue dust jacket with 'Everyman's Library' surrounded by scrollwork on front panel. --- The dust jacket is wrapped in a clear plastic wrapper, which has been permanently attached to the book using lots...

View More...

The Religio Medici and Other Writings (Everyman's Library #92)

By: BROWNE, Sir Thomas

Price: $19.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1945

Seller ID: 87940

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

A 1945 reprint of the 1906 issuance. A wartime Everyman's Library edition of the famous treatise on religion and Christianity by Sir Thomas Browne (1605-1682). Also included are other writings of Browne, including his "Christian Morals" and a glossary at rear of volume. The author was an intellectual and a physician who wrote on a wide variety of subjects. Includes an introduction by C. H. Herford. Entry 92 in the Everyman's Library Theology & Philosophy series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In EL binding style 3 with full blue cloth-covered boards and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eri...

View More...

The Poems & Plays of Robert Browning, 1844-1864: Volume II (Everyman's Library Flex Leatherette style, EL #42)

By: BROWNING, Robert

Price: $13.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1911

Seller ID: 82676

Binding: Flexible Leatherette

Condition: Fair with no dust jacket

Volume II only from Everyman's Library five-volume compilation of the poems and plays of the prolific Robert Browning (1812-1889). Includes his "Cavalier Tunes", "The Pied Piper of Hamelin", "The Italian in England", "The Englishman in Italy", 22 poems under the heading "Dramatis Personae" and much more. The introduction by John Bryson appears in Vol. I, not in this volume. Number 42 in Everyman's Library Poetry and the Drama series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In Everyman's style 1 maroon flexible leatherette variant binding with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt spine titling & floral ...

View More...

The Poems and Plays of Robert Browning, 1833-1844: Volume I (Everyman's Library Flex Leatherette binding, EL #41)

By: BROWNING, Robert

Price: $17.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1911

Seller ID: 82899

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good+ with no dust jacket

Volume I only in the Everyman's Library presentation of the poems and plays of Robert Browning. This volume mostly consists of his dramatic monologues and dialogues, such as "Pauline" and "The Return of the Druses". Includes an introduction by Arthur Waugh. Entry 41 in Everyman's Library Poetry and the Drama series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In Everyman's style 1 maroon flexible leatherette variant binding with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt titling & floral decorations to cover and spine, ornate Knowles woodcut illustrations to title and frontis pages and to endpapers, top edge gil...

View More...

The Ring and the Book (Everyman's Library #502)

By: BROWNING, Robert

Price: $15.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1932

Seller ID: 86857

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

A 1932 reprint of the 1911 issuance. The lengthy poem of Robert Browning is presented in twelve books, and tells of the life and trial of Count Guido Franceschini and other characters. Per D. A. Ross, within this work Browning's ". . .deepest insight into womanhood" is displayed. Edited by C. W. Hodell, who supplies an introduction and endnotes. This poem is volume III in Browning's Poems and Plays series. Entry 502 in EL Poetry and the Drama series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In 'Shield Era' curved back binding style 2, full olive ribbed cloth-covered boards with gilt-stamped Reginald Knowles...

View More...

Legends of Charlemagne (Everyman's Library #556)

By: BULFINCH, Thomas

Price: $18.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : [c.1911]

Seller ID: 87275

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good with no dust jacket

An undated, probable 1911 first edition. An Everyman's Library edition presenting Legends of Charlemagne by Thomas Bulfinch (1796-1867) for a younger reader. Some of the legends surrounding the 8th & 9th Century King of the Franks and his twelve prominent knights are shared. With an introduction by the author. Number 556 in Everyman's Library catalog in their "For Young People" series, edited by Ernest Rhys, who has also supplied a brief introduction. --- In 'flatback' binding style 1, full red cloth-covered ribbed boards with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt spine titling & decoration...

View More...

Silver Poets of the Sixteenth Century: Sir Thomas Wyatt, Henry Howard: Earl of Surrey, Sir Philip Sidney, Sir Walter Raleigh and Sir John Davies (Everyman's Library #985)

By: BULLETT, Gerald (editor)

Price: $20.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1951

Seller ID: 88474

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good in Very Good dust jacket

A 1949 reprint of the 1947 issuance. Editor Gerald Bullett has selected representative poems by five contemporaries of Shakespeare and Spenser, showing that these poets merited their own category, which he calls "Silver Poets." The work of Sir Thomas Wyatt, Henry Howard: Earl of Surrey, Sir Philip Sidney, Sir Walter Raleigh and Sir John Davies is included. Entry 985 in Everyman's Library Poetry series. --- In EL binding style 3 with full green cloth-covered boards and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to cover and brown topstain. In green dust jacket with...

View More...

Silver Poets of the Sixteenth Century: Sir Thomas Wyatt, Henry Howard: Earl of Surrey, Sir Philip Sidney, Sir Walter Raleigh and Sir John Davies (Everyman's Library #985)

By: BULLETT, Gerald (editor)

Price: $20.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1962

Seller ID: 88627

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Near Fine in Very Good+ dust jacket

A 1962 reprint of the 1947 issuance. Editor Gerald Bullett has selected representative poems by five contemporaries of Shakespeare and Spenser, showing that these poets merited their own category, which he calls "Silver Poets." The work of Sir Thomas Wyatt, Henry Howard: Earl of Surrey, Sir Philip Sidney, Sir Walter Raleigh and Sir John Davies is included. Index of first lines at rear of book. Entry 985 in Everyman's Library Poetry series. --- In Everyman's Library larger format binding style 4. Full blue cloth-covered boards with copper foil spine titling and interlocked "EL" at tail of spine...

View More...

The Pilgrim's Progress, From This World to that Which is to Come (Everyman's Library #204)

By: BUNYAN, John

Price: $21.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : [c.1907]

Seller ID: 87438

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good+ with no dust jacket

An undated likely First Everyman's Library edition, 1907. The famous Christian allegorical work in a compact Everyman's Library reprint edition. First published in two parts in 1678 and 1685; this single volume contains both, each preceded by the author's apology in verse. With an introduction by Rev. H. Elvet Lewis, which includes a few illustrations. Number 204 in Everyman's Library catalog in their Romance series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In "flatback" binding style 1, full blue cloth-covered boards with Reginald Knowles-designed spine titling & decorations in gilt, blindstamped J. M. Den...

View More...

Reflections on the French Revolution and Other Essays (First Everyman's Library edition, EL #460)

By: BURKE, Edmund

Price: $22.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : [c.1910]

Seller ID: 87003

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good+ with no dust jacket

An undated, probable first Everyman's Library edition, 1910. English philosopher and statesman Edmund Burke (1729-1797) was an influential shaper of public opinion. His reflections on the French Revolution are described as a "denunciation" by Donald Armstrong Ross. Also with other related writings by Mr. Burke. Includes an introduction by A. J. Grieve. An entry in Everyman's Library Essays and Belles Lettres series, edited by Ernest Rhys. EL #460. --- In flatback binding style 1, full orange ribbed cloth-covered boards with elaborate Reginald Knowles-designed gilt spine titling & decorations,...

View More...

Reflections on the Revolution in France (Everyman's Library #460)

By: BURKE, Edmund

Price: $16.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1967

Seller ID: 88642

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good- with no dust jacket

1967 reprint of the 1910 issuance. Irish-born English philosopher and statesman Edmund Burke (1729-1797) was an influential shaper of public opinion. His reflections on the French Revolution are described as a "denunciation" by Donald Armstrong Ross. Also with other related writings by Mr. Burke. Includes an introduction by A. J. Grieve. An entry in Everyman's Library Essays and Belles Lettres series. EL #460. --- In Everyman's Library larger format binding style 4. Full blue cloth-covered boards with gilt-stamped spine titling and interlocked "EL" in script at tail of spine; orange topstain. ...

View More...

Speeches and Letters on American Affairs (Everyman's Library #340)

By: BURKE, Edmund

Price: $16.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1945

Seller ID: 86039

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good+ with no dust jacket

A 1945 reprint of the 1908 issuance. Irish-born English statesman Edmund Burke (1729-1797) wrote and spoke often about the problems England was having with her American colonies. These thoughts are summarized in this Everyman's Library edition. With an introduction by High Law. E.L. no. 340 in Everyman's Library Oratory series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In EL binding style 3 with full orange cloth and gilt-stamped spine titling; blindstamped Eric Ravilious-designed 'shell' to cover and brown topstain. Volume lacks the dust jacket. --- With prior owner's rubberstampings to front & rear endpape...

View More...

Evelina, or A Young Lady's Entrance into the World (Everyman's Library Fiction series, EL #352)

By: BURNEY, Fanny

Price: $15.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1964

Seller ID: 88477

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good in Good+ dust jacket

A 1964 reprint of the 1909 issuance. Fanny Burney's novel was first published anonymously in 1778 and takes the form of diary entries made by a young aristocratic girl in England. This Everyman's Library edition with an introduction by Lewis Gibbs. #352 in EL's Fiction series. --- In larger EL format binding style 4. Full blue cloth-covered boards with gilt-stamped spine titling and gilt "EL" in script at tail of spine; pale orange topstain. In light blue dust jacket with J. S. Goodall black & white drawing of Evelina and a young man in fancy dress on front panel. --- A Good-only copy, with fr...

View More...

Life in Mexico (Everyman's Library #664)

By: CALDERÓN de la Barca, Frances

Price: $25.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1954

Seller ID: 87654

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Very Good+ with no dust jacket

A 1954 reprint of the 1913 issuance. An Everyman's Library edition presenting Frances Calderón de la Barca's description of the political, social and economic systems of Mexico in the early 19th century. The Scottish-born author married a diplomat who was posted to Mexico. These observations were made in the form of 54 letters sent to family members and weren't originally intended for publication. With an introduction by Manuel Romero de Terreros and a preface by the noted historian William H. Prescott. Everyman's Library #664, part of the EL Travel & Topography series. --- In Everyman's Libra...

View More...

Past and Present (Everyman's Library #608)

By: CARLYLE, Thomas

Price: $16.00

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1919

Seller ID: 85850

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Good+ with no dust jacket

A 1919 reprint of the 1912 issuance. An Everyman's Library edition presenting the 1843 collection of essays by Scotland's Thomas Carlyle (1795-1881). In this work, the author reshapes a medieval chronicle to comment on ". . .modern evils, social, political and cultural life [in Britain during his time]" (per Ross, p.84). With author's summary of the contents, as well as an index, at rear of volume. Includes an "appreciation" by Ralph Waldo Emerson. Number 608 in Everyman's Library catalog in their Essays and Belles-Lettres series, edited by Ernest Rhys. --- In flatback binding style 1, full or...

View More...

The Book of the Courtier ("Il Libro del Cortegiano") (Everyman's Library #807)

By: CASTIGLIONE, Baldassare

Price: $13.50

Publisher: London / New York, Everyman's Library - J. M. Dent & Sons Ltd. / E. P. Dutton & Co., Inc. : 1948

Seller ID: 87942

Binding: Hardcover

Condition: Fair with no dust jacket

A 1948 reprint of the 1928 issuance. Considered a masterpiece of the Italian Renaissance, Baldassare Castiglione's four dialogues discuss the "qualities of an ideal courtier (or renaissance gentleman)," per Donald Ross p. 87. Translated by Sir Thomas Hoby, with an introduction by W. H. D. Rouse and critical notes by Drayton Henderson. In this, his autobiography, Samuel Taylor Coleridge ". . .succeeds for the first and (so far) the last time in English criticism in marrying the twin studies of philosophy and literature" (Donald Armstrong Ross, p.103). Mr. Coleridge (1772-1834) was a prominent English poet, literary critic and philosopher. Includes an introduction by Arthur Symons.
